intro: Amygdalus carduchorum, commonly known as the Persian almond, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Iran and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar to almonds but are less commonly cultivated. Its botanical features include a woody structure and the ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Amygdalus carduchorum is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and potential agricultural significance.
